skill.name: drugbank-database
skill.description: Access and analyze comprehensive drug information from the DrugBank database including drug properties, interactions, targets, pathways, chemical structures, and pharmacology data. This skill should be used when working with pharmaceutical data, drug discovery research, pharmacology studies, drug-drug interaction analysis, target identification, chemical similarity searches, ADMET predictions, or any task requiring detailed drug and drug target information from DrugBank.

security_audit.summary: Legitimate scientific research tool for accessing pharmaceutical data from DrugBank. All capabilities are consistent with stated purpose. Environment variable access is for authentication to DrugBank. Network access is to official DrugBank API endpoints. No malicious patterns detected.

content.value_statement: Research requires detailed drug data for discovery and safety analysis. This skill provides programmatic access to DrugBank database containing over 9,500 drugs with properties, interactions, targets, and pathways for pharmacology research and drug safety analysis.
actual_capabilities: Query drugs by DrugBank ID, name, CAS number, or keywords
Extract drug properties including SMILES, InChI, molecular weight, and logP
Analyze drug-drug interactions with severity classification
Identify drug targets, enzymes, transporters, and biological pathways
Calculate chemical similarity using Tanimoto coefficients and fingerprints
Predict ADMET properties and drug-likeness using Lipinski rules
limitations: Requires free DrugBank account and license acceptance for data access
Large database download requires significant disk space (1-2 GB)
Chemical similarity analysis requires RDKit package installation
Rate limits apply to API access based on license type

use_cases.title: Drug mechanism research
use_cases.description: Identify drug targets and map mechanisms of action for pharmacology studies and publications

use_cases.title: Interaction safety analysis
use_cases.description: Check drug-drug interactions and assess polypharmacy safety for patient medication regimens

use_cases.title: Compound similarity search
use_cases.description: Find structurally similar compounds for lead optimization and drug repurposing opportunities

prompt_templates.title: Get drug information
prompt_templates.prompt: Get comprehensive information for drug [DrugBank ID or name] including name, type, indication, mechanism of action, and chemical properties.

prompt_templates.title: Check interactions
prompt_templates.prompt: Check all drug-drug interactions for [drug names or IDs]. Classify by severity and summarize clinical significance.

prompt_templates.title: Find similar drugs
prompt_templates.prompt: Find drugs structurally similar to [drug] using Tanimoto similarity. Include similarity scores and known indications.

prompt_templates.title: Full pathway analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Map all targets, enzymes, and pathways for [drug]. Identify CYP450 metabolism involvement and potential off-target effects.

output_examples.input: Get information for aspirin including its drug-drug interactions
output: Indication: Pain, fever, and inflammation prevention
Major Interactions: Warfarin (increased bleeding risk), Methotrexate (enhanced toxicity)
CYP450 Metabolism: Primarily metabolized by CYP2C9

best_practices: Specify exact DrugBank version for reproducible research and cite it in publications
Store credentials in environment variables and never hardcode passwords in scripts
Cache parsed database to avoid re-downloading and re-parsing during analysis sessions
anti_patterns: Using the skill without verifying DrugBank license terms for your use case
Relying solely on computational predictions without clinical validation
Ignoring the bidirectional nature of drug-drug interaction data

faq.question: Is DrugBank free to access?
faq.answer: Academic users can access DrugBank for free after creating an account and accepting the license. Commercial use requires a paid license.

faq.question: How much disk space does the database require?
faq.answer: The full DrugBank XML database requires approximately 1-2 GB of disk space when downloaded and extracted.

faq.question: Can I use this with other cheminformatics tools?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill integrates with RDKit for chemical fingerprints, NetworkX for interaction networks, and pandas for data manipulation.

faq.question: Is my credential data safe?
faq.answer: The skill recommends using environment variables for credentials and never hardcodes them. Always verify your credential storage follows security best practices.

faq.question: Why is my query running slowly?
faq.answer: First-time queries parse the full database. Cache parsed data using pickle to speed up subsequent queries. Consider building index dictionaries for frequent lookups.

faq.question: How does this compare to PubChem or ChEMBL?
faq.answer: DrugBank specializes in drug-centric data with curated drug-drug interactions, targets, and pathway mappings. It complements other databases with more detailed pharmacology information.
